Dataframe Report

Source: R/report.character.R, R/report.data.frame.R, R/report.factor.R, and 2 more
report.data.frame.Rd

Create a report of a dataframe.

# S3 method for character
report(
  model,
  n_entries = 3,
  levels_percentage = FALSE,
  missing_percentage = FALSE,
  ...
)

# S3 method for data.frame
report(
  model,
  median = FALSE,
  centrality = TRUE,
  dispersion = TRUE,
  range = TRUE,
  distribution = FALSE,
  levels_percentage = FALSE,
  n_entries = 3,
  missing_percentage = FALSE,
  ...
)

# S3 method for factor
report(model, levels_percentage = FALSE, ...)

# S3 method for numeric
report(
  model,
  median = FALSE,
  centrality = TRUE,
  dispersion = TRUE,
  range = TRUE,
  distribution = FALSE,
  missing_percentage = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

model

A data.frame or a vector.
n_entries

Number of different character entries to show. Can be "all".
levels_percentage

Show characters entries and factor levels by number (default) or percentage.
missing_percentage

Show missings by number (default) or percentage.
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.
median

Show mean and sd (default) or median and mad.
centrality

Show index of centrality (mean or median).
dispersion

Show index of dispersion (sd or mad).
range

Show range.
distribution

Returns Kurtosis and Skewness in table.

See also

report

report

report

report

Examples

x <- c("A", "B", "C", "A", "B", "B", "D", "E", "B", "D", "A")
report(x)
#> 5 entries: B, n = 4; A, n = 3; D, n = 2 and 2 others (0 missing)
model_table(x)
#> n_Entries | n_Obs | n_Missing | percentage_Missing |                      Entries
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>         5 |    11 |         0 |                  0 | B, n = 4; A, n = 3; D, n = 2
model_text(x)
#> 5 entries: B, n = 4; A, n = 3; D, n = 2 and 2 others (0 missing)
summary(model_table(x))
#> n_Entries | n_Obs | n_Missing |                      Entries
#> ------------------------------------------------------------
#>         5 |    11 |         0 | B, n = 4; A, n = 3; D, n = 2
summary(model_text(x))
#> 5 entries: B, n = 4; A, n = 3; D, n = 2 and 2 others
library(report)

r <- report(iris, median = TRUE, dispersion = FALSE, distribution = TRUE, missing_percentage = TRUE)
r
#> The data contains 150 observations of the following variables:
#>   - Sepal.Length: Mean = 5.84, SD = 0.83, Median = 5.80, MAD = 1.04, range: [4.30, 7.90], Skewness = 0.31, Kurtosis = -0.57, 0% missing
#>   - Sepal.Width: Mean = 3.06, SD = 0.44, Median = 3.00, MAD = 0.44, range: [2, 4.40], Skewness = 0.32, Kurtosis = 0.18, 0% missing
#>   - Petal.Length: Mean = 3.76, SD = 1.77, Median = 4.35, MAD = 1.85, range: [1, 6.90], Skewness = -0.27, Kurtosis = -1.40, 0% missing
#>   - Petal.Width: Mean = 1.20, SD = 0.76, Median = 1.30, MAD = 1.04, range: [0.10, 2.50], Skewness = -0.10, Kurtosis = -1.34, 0% missing
#>   - Species: 3 levels: setosa (n = 50, 33.33%); versicolor (n = 50, 33.33%) and virginica (n = 50, 33.33%)
summary(r)
#> The data contains 150 observations of the following variables:
#>   - Sepal.Length: Median = 5.80, range = [4.30, 7.90], Skewness = 0.31, Kurtosis = -0.57, 0% missing
#>   - Sepal.Width: Median = 3.00, range = [2, 4.40], Skewness = 0.32, Kurtosis = 0.18, 0% missing
#>   - Petal.Length: Median = 4.35, range = [1, 6.90], Skewness = -0.27, Kurtosis = -1.40, 0% missing
#>   - Petal.Width: Median = 1.30, range = [0.10, 2.50], Skewness = -0.10, Kurtosis = -1.34, 0% missing
#>   - Species: 3 levels: setosa, n = 50; versicolor, n = 50 and virginica, n = 50

library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
r <- iris %>%
  dplyr::group_by(Species) %>%
  report()

x <- factor(rep(c("A", "B", "C"), 10))
report(x)
#> 3 levels: A (n = 10, 33.33%); B (n = 10, 33.33%) and C (n = 10, 33.33%)
model_table(x)
#> Level | n_Obs | percentage_Obs
#> ------------------------------
#> A     |    10 |          33.33
#> B     |    10 |          33.33
#> C     |    10 |          33.33
model_text(x)
#> 3 levels: A (n = 10, 33.33%); B (n = 10, 33.33%) and C (n = 10, 33.33%)
summary(model_table(x))
#> Level | n_Obs
#> -------------
#> A     |    10
#> B     |    10
#> C     |    10
summary(model_text(x))
#> 3 levels: A, n = 10; B, n = 10 and C, n = 10
x <- rnorm(1000)
report(x)
#> Mean = 0.00, SD = 1.00, Median = 0.01, MAD = 1.00, range: [-2.94, 2.76], Skewness = 0.00, Kurtosis = -0.20, 0 missing
report(x, median = TRUE, missing_percentage = TRUE, distribution = TRUE)
#> Mean = 0.00, SD = 1.00, Median = 0.01, MAD = 1.00, range: [-2.94, 2.76], Skewness = 0.00, Kurtosis = -0.20, 0% missing
model_table(x)
#> Mean |   SD | Median |  MAD |   Min |  Max | n_Obs | Skewness | Kurtosis | n_Missing
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> 0.00 | 1.00 |   0.01 | 1.00 | -2.94 | 2.76 |  1000 |     0.00 |    -0.20 |         0
model_text(x)
#> Mean = 0.00, SD = 1.00, Median = 0.01, MAD = 1.00, range: [-2.94, 2.76], Skewness = 0.00, Kurtosis = -0.20, 0 missing
summary(model_table(x))
#> Mean |   SD |   Min |  Max | n_Obs | n_Missing
#> ----------------------------------------------
#> 0.00 | 1.00 | -2.94 | 2.76 |  1000 |         0
summary(model_text(x))
#> Mean = 0.00, SD = 1.00, range = [-2.94, 2.76], 0 missing
